Reviews.Title: Phooey on 'FAKE'
Reviews.Author: N22Tango "Film tonight at 10"
Reviews.Content: I live on a farm, miles from the nearest town and neighbors. My place has been hit a couple of times, quick grab and go scoundrels and not much more. I purchased 6 of these to place around our property and I used lithium batteries, not the cheaper types that you might install in a flashlight.The lithium batteries power a small red LED light that blinks on and off and give the impression the cameras are "on" and "seeing" what might be in their view. The LEDs have been blinking reliably for a month straight and at night they look VERY real.I'm impressed with this device because they resemble true cameras that emit an invisible infrared light for night viewing. They have held up well in storms and are easy to adjust and rotate. If someone looks close at the front of the camera, it appears to have built in infrared illuminators. These are the new technology "lights" that provide an invisible light that the eye can not see, but a professional crook might understand and know is the same style of light used on expensive "game cameras" that hunters use to capture images of animals at night.I'm happy with my purchase and I feel these "fake" cameras do a good job to discourage thieves.(UPDATE... NOVEMBER 2013.  These "cameras" are still working well and in the 2 years since I wrote this review, I have not had any crooks steal anything from me.Some points...* Lithium batteries. Sometimes they will run the camera for 3 weeks and sometimes they run 5 weeks. I surmise this might have something to do with cold or hot season.* Some discussions here stating "no wires" and my thoughts are "no big deal" because WiFi cameras look a lot like this and, cameras placed around by deer hunters have no wires, because the have SD cards that can record video.Bottom line... in two years, I have not had a failure in anyone of the 6 "cameras" I bought, and the little red blinking LED light is easy to see at night. They have been sitting outside, unprotected and have been rained on, snowed on, have stayed out in the Texas sun (it was 111 degrees here one summer) and they haven't missed a beat.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: Looks good.  Can't tell it's a fake.  It takes 2 AA batteries.  I have had it on for 3 months and it is still blinking bright.  Gonna get another one to mount on the garage wall.

Reviews.Title: Let me mention..it draws attention...if thats your intention
Reviews.Author: powerop
Reviews.Content: Just a couple weeks ago I heard noises outside very late at night and saw through the 2nd floor window two punks trying to break into a car. I made a noise, they saw me, and they ran away. I imediately wanted something to deter this from happening again so I got this fake vid cam as a temporary measure until I get something that takes real photos. So far no noises, but its too early to tell.From my point of view, this fake camera looks real from afar, especially if you install it somewhere elevated and out of reach. I highly recommend the latter because, up close, it looks and feels plasticy. At night, a trespasser might not tell the difference. But since its low quality and empty inside, it can be easily destroyed and knocked down (by the trespasser). ANother tip, it comes with a realistic power wire stemming from behind the camera down to the mounting bracket., but obviously, you have to install it in a place where its believable. Dont be installing it on a palm tree or concrete wall expecting burglars to think there's power running to the camera.The battery compartment was a real pain to take off, I felt like I was ripping the thing apart. But once installed the red LED light blinked continuously for 1 second every second. So it WILL be noticed. Now people will know you have "eyes at night". WIll they think its fake? WIll they think you are protecting something important? Only time will tell, because this camera won't.UPDATE 10/26/12 *******Its been a year now since I originally wrote this review, and so far I haven't come across an incident where I was startled by suspicious activity from the outside (knock on wood). I did have to replace the batteries once during this time period... just dont let anyone see you put batteries in a security camera with a cable running into the wall.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product.
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: The "camera" appears real and the blinking light can be seen from a long distance.Can not tell that this is not a real camera.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good, not great
Reviews.Author: M. B.
Reviews.Content: The most important question anyone should be asking themselves regarding a dummy camera is; does it look real. Will it fool people into thinking it's an actual functioning camera. If the answer is yes, then you have found what you're looking for and you should consider buying it. But what if the answer isn't quite "yes." What if it only comes close?I liked the way this camera looked over the others that were offered and I bought it. When it arrived, my initial thought was; I guess it looks as real as a plastic camera can. Sometimes it's hard to tell from an item's picture of what you're going to get until you actually hold it in your hand. Don't get me wrong, the photo they have posted is actually what you will receive. There is no deception; just understand it's all plastic. Maybe real security camera's and their accociated mounting brackets are actually made of plastic these days, I don't know. I guess I was hoping for some thin aluminum somewhere to help with the deception. I agree with the other reviewers in one sense; it does look real ... but I have to add, 'if it's not viewed too closely or when it's dark.' If you have somewhere high you can mount it, I think you will be pleased. Keep in mind not to mount it too high because you will eventually have to replace the batteries (2 AA, not included.) Also, don't mount it directly under an unmovable object for the same reason. The battery compartment is on top of the camera and you don't want to take the entire camera down just to swap out the batteries.This camera comes close and I am currently using it. It has fooled some of my neighbors already and that's a good sign it's doing what it was intended to do. On the other hand, my neighbors might just be humoring me and not saying anything.

Reviews.Title: Use as a decoy
Reviews.Author: T. Rummel "TheCollector"
Reviews.Content: This is not a direct comment on this model as we purchased one about a year ago for my friend whom had been robbed. I am writing this as advice to others. When my friend installed security cameras outside his house he was afraid the person who robbed him would simply break the cameras. So we bought 2 dummy cameras and put them in more obvious areas on the front and back doors.  Then had two real cameras watching the front and back doors hidden much better.  The same group hit his house this time caught on camera spray painting the front of the dummy cameras but caught in the act with the real cameras. Worked perfect.

Reviews.Title: Blinking light is a giveaway, leave the battery out!
Reviews.Author: R. Majors
Reviews.Content: Fake cameras have not kept pace with real camera technology.  In the early days of security cameras a pilot light was in fact used to indicate that the camera was on but not anymore.  I have not seen a blinking light on a real camera in many years so just leave the battery out unless you want your camera to appear fake.  There are some other giveaways that fake cameras need to address if they are going to appear to have infrared night vision.  Infrared light from a real camera is not invisible at the source as the concentric ring of infrared LEDs would have a warm red glow at night that you would be able to see if you were in target range of the camera.Even still, fake cameras are a great investment as long as they don't have a red blinking LED.

Reviews.Title: Great product. I recommend it highly
Reviews.Author: C. Foster "Road Warrior"
Reviews.Content: I ordered two of these cameras.  They both worked better than expected. However, after observing Security Cameras in stores and the cameras atop Walmart, I removed the batteries from mine.  None of the Profession Store Mounted Cameras had 'flashing' lights.  Plus, the 'real' Cameras that I already had mounted, didn't have 'flashing' lights.  Now, the unwanted visitors will have to wonder which are 'real' and which may not be 'real'.I may order more of these for my other locations.Well worth the money.  I recommend them highly.

Reviews.Title: works too good?
Reviews.Author: WP
Reviews.Content: After having my work space broken into, I got this fake camera as a theft deterrent.  It lasted about 4 days, before someone climbed 15 ft to rip it off the wall.  Now they know it was a dummy camera and I doubt I will replace it with another.  Next time, I'm getting the real thing so those punks can be caught.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied with the product!
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Velez
Reviews.Content: The quality was better than what we were expecting. We ordered 5 of these and everybody has thought they were real!

Reviews.Title: Loosen before adjusting!
Reviews.Author: K. B.
Reviews.Content: This thing looks real to me, but (to quote RMN) I'm no crook. Like most people I'm willing to pay 9 bucks for the chance it will fool a crook. I think it at least gives me an advantage over the person with no camera- real or fake. Some folks don't like the flashing light, but a fake camera is worthless if it doesn't get seen and the light gets it seen. There are also complaints that it is not well-made. It isn't, but it looks like it is. It seems fairly intuitive, but before you attempt to adjust the camera angle you need to loosen the rounded knob on the bottom of the pivot joint. I suspect a lot of people broke the arm trying to adjust without loosening this joint.UPDATE: Battery life is a little disappointing. I installed four "cameras" on 6/19/13 and all four went dead on 9/8/13. I now agree with the reviewers who recommend leaving the batteries out. The flashing light is pretty unsubtle and can be seen from hundreds of feet away. Not really necessary. Even without the light, I am pretty sure an intruder will notice the device because he will be looking for it. So, overall, I still give it 5 STARS.

Reviews.Title: amazing!
Reviews.Author: Javier E Grajeda
Reviews.Content: my neighbors were spying on me while i installed it lol... the battery has lasted well over a month which is a plus, it just sucks that i have to lie to my neighbors, one of them asked me if my cameras (i bought two) had caught anything since one of his cars was vandalized, all i could say is that they only cover the inside of my house. so all in all they r believable & at nite you can really tell the red blinking light from far away. i'll try to upload pics or even a video later.

Reviews.Title: Shocked how real they look
Reviews.Author: R. Fortunato
Reviews.Content: I was really worried the quality was not going to be good. I was wrong!!! They look as real as a $200 camera. I'm ordering more... Easy to install.

Reviews.Title: VERY REALISTIC
Reviews.Author: CAROL VASPOL
Reviews.Content: First off, I am an electrician. I have installed hundreds of these types of cameras in the past. I can assure you that these cameras look EXACTLY like the REAL THING. It does come with a blinking red LED light. Personally, if you are concerned with this camera looking authentic, I would highly suggest that you DO NOT activate the red light. It has been a long time since camera's like this have utilized any type of flashing light. If you want to "announce" the presence of the cameras, then purchase the package of plastic signs to post around the camera's location. They are BIG, RED and WHITE with an image of a camera on them. Hard to miss.This camera looks very realistic even upon close inspection, mostly due to the "infrared" illuminators that are present in both this item and in the real thing. Just be sure to thread the wire THRU the mounting bracket, then push it back inside...so that it looks like the wire then goes "into" the wall. Just like the real thing!

Reviews.Title: Pretty good, but the thieves have them figured out.
Reviews.Author: TankerHC
Reviews.Content: I integrated these with my real cameras for purposes of confusion. After reading and talking to Security Installers and looking at my 3 real cameras, something I learned, the thieves have these figured out already, but you can fix that.First off real cameras do not have a blinking red light on front. To thieves this is a dead giveaway. Leave the battery out. Real Camera's have a green light on the back, and it does not blink and is only for the purpose of showing that the camera's are activated. But, as soon as a knowledgable thief sees a blinking red light on a security camera, that tells them this is fake. And to note, I am not giving away anything here, that information is available on many of the Security sites.Secondly, real camera's can be wireless but if they are they do not necessarily have a visible antennae. None of mine do. But they all have some power source, not batteries. They will not have the single thick wire that you see on these (At least the camera's I received). They will have two thin wires going into a hole behind the camera.Blinking red light and single thick wire is a dead giveaway to the thieves.Drop the battery and drill two tiny holes behind the camera. Get yourself some red and black thin wire and attach it to the back of the camera (I used a small piece of electrical tape) and stick the other ends of the wires in the holes.Thieves wont know the difference between real and fake.Otherwise they look absolutely real and were pretty soldily built, even compared to my real cameras.

Reviews.Title: Looks real
Reviews.Author: Rachel Hester
Reviews.Content: I don't want to embarrass anyone I know by naming names, but several people who saw these thought that they were real. We installed it at the same time as a real security system , so ithat probably contributed to it's apparent authenticity.  I have had the same batteries in for a few months now, and they have not quit yet, but it still looks real without the blinking light.

Reviews.Title: Good product for the money.
Reviews.Author: JMann
Reviews.Content: This unit is just what it says and while its all plastic it does seem real from a distance.  The red LED stays on about 2 sec then off for 1 sec as long as there are 2 AA batteries.  Note that you need to mount it in a place where the camera is 3-4" above the mounting bracket.  Overall, a good product for the money.

Reviews.Title: Mildly convincing
Reviews.Author: John W. Graham
Reviews.Content: I got this fake security cam for an added measure of deterrence.The camera housing is all plastic and the camera is silver.  From a distance, this looks like a real security camera.  Anything closer than 3 feet and you will know this is a toy.  I even had a neighbor come over and immediately ask why I had mounted a fake camera.  In his words, "from a distance it looks real and the wire and LED are convincing, but as you get closer, it really looks bad."Be aware of discrepancies in the product description.  As shown, the camera looks like it has three mounting holes.  The actual unit has only two.  Not a big deal, but a discrepancy nonetheless.  Under "Technical Details," the product description states "a Yellow security sticker is included."  Mine did not come with any stickers or documentation; just the cam and some mounting screws stuffed in a box.  Installation is self-explanatory but I would have liked the stickers.  The details also say "The camera requires 2 AA batteries that are not included."  In reality, the camera takes 2 AAA batteries which are not included.Arm movement and positioning is very limited.  I had to mount the camera much higher than I anticipated because the head does not tilt the way I thought it would.  I personally think the fake dome cameras are more convincing.  Get this only if it will be mounted such that close inspection is not possible.

Reviews.Title: It works!
Reviews.Author: KingV
Reviews.Content: Well, I should say, the combination of four dummy cameras and four real cameras has completely deterred unwanted solicitors. I manage a property in downtown LA, and even with a 6 foot tall fence, we had homeless people stepping on stools and reaching over to unlock the door to take our trash. Not that we miss our trash, but if they can get in, anyone else could. Sometimes when the gate was unlocked, people would just "wander" into our property as well.I installed four dummy and four real cameras, as well as security signs, and we have not had any incidents anymore. The dummy cameras do not look so different from the real ones, and the blinking red light looks real. At the low price point and increase of security, these are a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Looks real enough
Reviews.Author: BobComment "BobComment"
Reviews.Content: This was pretty simple to install and looks real enough.  The fake cord that inserts into the base is a nice touch.  I actually have real security cameras installed around the house, but wanted this to cover a back door that is not picked up by the real cameras.  There are a few differences between this one and my real cameras.First the blinking light.  The real IR cameras don't have the light.  I suppose this is to attract attention to the light, which if you are using a fake is probably the point.  Either way, if you don't want to use the light, simply don't put any batteries in it.I think the biggest giveaway that this is a fake is the fact that it is about 3x the size of a standard camera and 2x the size of my 170 degree wide angle camera.  Modern cameras are now pretty small and this, while not overly large, is certainly oversized.  Again, since this is a decoy this could help bring attention to the camera, which you might desire.Overall I'm happy with it and think it will serve its purpose.

Reviews.Title: This sucks, I repeat, this sucks
Reviews.Author: Andrew Downing
Reviews.Content: My house has been broken into before, as I live in a roughish neighborhood. I thought I'd buy a couple of these cameras to bluff away potential intruders. I was surprised how fake these look. I read a review warning me of this, but bought them against better judgement. These are a shining example of made-in-china crap. They're made of cheap plastic and they look like a toy. When I was installing one of them close to the entrance of my house, I was attempting to adjust the angle to face the door and it broke in half.These would fool only the most naive of vandals. These would not fool anyone who actually is an experienced intruder or burglar. If you live in a small town or rural area, on a long shot, these might deter kids from tagging your barn, but I wouldn't count on them for anything else.Do yourself a favor and don't buy this. Absolutely money down the drain.

Reviews.Title: Cumple con su trabajo
Reviews.Author: JCHUQUI
Reviews.Content: I love it! this is my 4th camera: 3 indoor sm3601s and 1 outdoor (is the same camera with different arm or bracket).I have had the chance of seeing a lot of real security cameras here in Peru, imported from USA,  and i must to say that this fake camera looks real, the arm of the camera is plastic but looks like metal , good job! but we have to keep in mind that the entire OUTDOOR camera is plastic so i suggest to put a "little roof" over the camera, so it will be protected from the climate.The battery last approximately 3 months with 2 rechargeable battery AA, 2700 mah.Ah! just an anecdote, one of my cameras had a little bit accident, I was installing the camera when accidentally i let it fall down from 4 meters, the camera suffered a split on the back (problem solved with a black insulating tape) and the blinking light? .... is still blinking.Bye

Reviews.Title: GREAT looking fake cameras at a great price!! **UPDATED 08-10-12**
Reviews.Author: OCguy
Reviews.Content: *********NOTE: I noticed a couple customer reviews stating they did not receive the exact camera that is pictured. There are even customer sumitted photos that show what he got was clearly not what is being advertised. I don't know what determines which one you get....but I personally got the camera that is being advertised. So my review is based on the camera that is advertised.**********I can't say how much I am impressed with the look of this camera. Most of the reviews have given it a positive rating on how realistic it looks. I always keep my expectations and standards low though. Especailly with a fake camera.I purchased two in hopes of creating a more secured look to my home. Received them quickly with Prime and couldn't believe it when I opened them up!! These cameras look so real!! The lens. The infrared lights. The overall look.There have been a few reviews stating that the low grade plastic makes the camera look fake. I guess that must be a personal opinion.....I personally think it looks great up close, even better mounted on a wall.Installing them was a breeze. I installed both in just under an hour. The only reason it even took me that long was because I took time in deciding where exactly I wanted to put them. I put them up about 10-12ft high from the ground. I'm telling you...I would challenge you to tell me that you knew for a fact those cameras were fake. They look so good. The blinking red LED just sinches the deal. It let's people know there is some sort of power source to these things. It's not just an empty plastic casing. Even more reason to believe that they may be real! Even my nosey neighbor was impressed when she stopped by to talk to me about my impressive new camera system, never once questioning if they were real or not.Now...I've also seen multiple reviews for this, as well as several other, fake cameras concerning the flashing red LED light. Reviews ranging from everyday people to security camera installers that have practically done installations since the security camera was invented[sarcasm]. They all say that no real camera has that blinking light. That it's a dead give away that it's fake. Well...unfortunately I don't have the luxury of a real system. During the day, sure ok, I guess people can see the cameras even without the LED. They look super real and all that.....but if I don't have the blinking LED going at night, there might as well be nothing there...because you can't SEE it. The camera is FAKE. It cannot record. It's NOT night vision capable. So I NEED it to be seen at night. I need a potential thief to be able to SEE, even in the dark, something possibly watching them. It does me no good to have a fake realistic camera at night that cannot be seen. It defeats it's whole purpose. To be a deterrent.Plus, if my home is being staked out by the Ocean's 13 crew, I doubt I'll stand a chance even WITH real cameras.You everyday lowlife and common robber are not going to risk breaking into a home or office with these cameras just becuase they MIGHT be fake because they have a blinking red LED. Why risk it? They'll just move onto the next house or business that doesn't have ANY cameras. Real or fake. I know I would.These cameras are not a fancy $500-$1000 complete CCTV home system....but I think they do the same thing: Deter. That's what we all really want. Right? We want to deter any illicit act. These cameras will give you just that....and only at just a little over $10 each. That is quite a bargain.Each camera also comes with a little 4x4 yellow sticker with a camera silhouette and "CCTV" printed on it. Great litte addition to the whole package.I also wanted to address the reviews talking about the flimsy the joint is, as well as the mounting bracket....all because of the cheap plastic used to make these. I have to agree.....it defnintely feels like if you put too much force, you'll break something. So guess what? I didn't man handle it. I was calm and gentle with it. I mean it's a $10 fake camera. You really expect it to be able to take someone moving it and yanking it around? Also, when I mounted the camera to the wall, I didn't screw in the screws so hard so as to keep the camera there for all time. The camera isn't heavy. It doesn't have to be practically fused to the wall to stay.So yes, it does feel flimsy somewhat. It may even break with a little excessive force....But if you are careful with it, it will survive the installation and look great up and running. I've purchased three and all have made it without breaking.I highly recommend this product to add onto your existing security system or even create your own "security system".*********UPDATE 08-10-12***********As of today, two of the three cameras' batteries have died completely. The third cameras seems to be going strong. I wrote my original review the day after installing them. So on July 13th, I installed two, brand new Energizer AA batteries in each camera. I'm not sure if it's the brand of battery(I'm more partial to Duracell, but only had Energizer on hand) or if it's the camera. I expected it to last at least a couple of months. Either way, that's my only complaint thus far. I'll be trying out some Duracell batteries this time. See if that makes a difference. Still very happy with the cameras though!!

Reviews.Title: Dummy Security Cameras
Reviews.Author: ChrisG
Reviews.Content: Pleased w/simplicity of installation.  Red blinking light, casing, fake wire all contribute to acceptable appearance of active security camera system.  Security system labels on windows & lawn signage eliminate need to display oversized 'security camera' sticker provided w/cameras.  Local PD impressed w/low cost approach to home security.

Reviews.Title: Real Hybrid Fakery
Reviews.Author: James R. Livingston "DocZoom"
Reviews.Content: These realistic dummies are a great concept! If you think about it, the primary working principle for surveillance cameras is simply the intimidation factor. Actually capturing an image of a crime and the violators in action is not a solution. At that point, the damage is done and you'll likely not find the bad guys even with high quality images of them. They'll be long gone with your stuff forever.I bought two of the fakes here and one real working surveillance camera. Once they are all in place, I can keep watch and record a "live zone" while creating the illusion that there is somewhat greater comprehensive coverage. Even from just a few feet away, one can't distinguish between the dummies and the real camera. This "hybrid" system is very effective and saves a boat-load of cash. (Real security cameras, of any quality, are very expensive. An entire system is radically pricey.)Our neighbors all know that we have just installed surveillance cameras. Even on sunny days, the blinking red LED lights command attention. The blinking light is a nice touch. It's very bright and draws attention to itself... so much so that it will invite thieves to take a second glance. It looks very real but mount it high and out of reach because if a thief is able to touch it, then the illusion is gone. You see, it's made of plastic and is somewhat light weight. A slight nudge is all it takes to realize that it's hollow and weightless.Requires two AA batteries that install under the hood (on top) which is removed by sliding off. It's not exactly a water-tight design. A heavy, blowing rain will likely soak the battery compartment at some point (even though the hood covers it).Not, sure how long two AA batteries will last with an LED light flashing constantly. Hopefully, I won't have to drag a ladder out every few weeks to replace batteries.Bottom line... thieves know that dummy cameras exist. They know that bogus security signs and decals exist. But, if there is any doubt about whether the camera is recording an image or not (or if there may be an active alarm), then would-be intruders will just pass you by to avoid any potential trouble.

Reviews.Title: They look so real!!
Reviews.Author: Tina Slouf
Reviews.Content: I got these because there was a series of robberies in the neighborhood .  Hopefully, the robbers will think they are real and steal the neighbors copper pipe and leave us alone!  My friend had them and I thought they were real and asked him how he had them tied into his computer.Just don't be a fool and tell a soul they are not real.. you never know who is doing the robberies.

Reviews.Title: please read my review for battery specifics
Reviews.Author: Heather Rankin
Reviews.Content: Because I am a bit of a nerd, I wanted to see how long these blinked before the batteries died. Per another reviewer's advice I bought the higher end batteries (Duracell copper top Ultrapower). The cameras blinked right at 3 months- which is fine I just wanted to let people know how long these particular batteries last, b/c the cameras blink continuously. Wish there was a way to turn off during the day but not a big deal.  It is easy to change batteries, the annoyance is getting out the ladder and climbing up there to change them- but considering I only have to do this 4 times a year, that's not too bad!

Reviews.Title: It's very small but effective
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: I expected a much bigger camera so it would be highly visible to thieves.  This one is only about 8 inches long.  However, it does look realistic and I proceeded to mount it within 5 minutes.  From outside and 50 feet away, the blinking light looks effective and I think this dummy camera, when combined with a sign that the area is under video surveillance, will deter thieves.  It takes two AAA batteries which are not included. You probably should mount it under a roof so it is never exposed to rain.

Reviews.Title: Looks like a pro!
Reviews.Author: Old'nCranky
Reviews.Content: This little jewel is doing the trick! The only thing might be to make the blinker a bit less bright, otherwise it looks real - if you don't tell someone it's fake you'd never know! Also, when you install it, leave enough room to take off the top cover to easily replace the two batteries. Good luck with screwing with your scumbag's theives minds!!!--lol.

Reviews.Title: Battery life
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 cameras and 4 lithium batteries. I hoped I could go 6 months or more before changing batteries. Both cameras stopped blinking in about 3 weeks. The cameras look good, are installed and I will live without the blinking feature. Batteries are too expensive to ask the manufacturer for replacements.

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny if you want a camera that looks like it costs less than $10
Reviews.Author: Rocky Racoon
Reviews.Content: The product picture, product description, and all the 5-star reviews led me to think this would be a great buy at such a low price. It's a great attempt at a decoy camera, but falls short.The blinking light is far too bright and located behind the "camera lens" right at 6:00 (bottom, center). With the camera pointed downward, the red light illuminates/reflects on the bottom half of the "lens". This alone is a complete giveaway since it would produce a red glow for several frames of the recording every other second. At night time, it would probably block out the picture entirely.The plastic...well, it's a good attempt at plastic trying to look like metal. It's not too obvious as long as the decoy is more than 15 feet away. Any closer than that and it looks suspiciously like a plastic toy. Also, the plastic visor on top is a bit flimsy...Even though it is secured in a couple of grooves on the side, it seems a strong wind gust could blow it off.Adjusting the camera can be a bit tricky - once you tighten it into place, it is hard to loosen and re-adjust. Others have reported breaking the camera unintentionally because of this according to many of the 1-star reviews.In the end, if you want a decoy, I recommend looking elsewhere. I would have given a higher rating if this camera was advertised as a plastic model and not as a "Dummy Security Camera" and I could not disagree more with this statement in the product description: "even the most sophisticated criminals will think the premise is guarded by a high-tech surveillance system".

Reviews.Title: Everyone thinks it's the real thing.
Reviews.Author: Terry okerstrom
Reviews.Content: Bought this with a motion sensor for less than $20 for both. Mounted above motion sensormy shop entry door. Fooled my insurance agent! His job is to spot fraud.

Reviews.Title: Great deterrent!
Reviews.Author: Lefgaw
Reviews.Content: I have this on the back of my house as a deterrent because we live on a dark alley.  It looks real enough that no one would want to chance it and the batteries for the blinking light lasts at least six months.  Why not?

Reviews.Title: Look very real.
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: These look very good.  The imitation lens and LEDs look as real and any I've seen.  They mounted up very easy with three small screws in the base. I mounted them under an eve on the house so they stay looking good for a few years. Along with the ADT sign and stickers, this should make the home look like a hard target for thousands less than MP cameras with cloud recording (which in my judgement is the only REAL way to ID crooks after the fact)  The DVR that records the "probably human" quality and gets stolen anyway. makes no sense to me.  So in the meantime, this should act a a deterrent..

Reviews.Title: Red light to bright
Reviews.Author: K. Austin "Uliekdixbro"
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for seller and people who packaged it, however for the product....the LED is was to bright and makes it look fake.  I recommend dulling it down a bit with a magic marker or electrical tape.

Reviews.Title: Looks Real
Reviews.Author: Kevin W. Maness "Electronics Guru"
Reviews.Content: I suggest running another fake cord to camera. So then you have the one that's included, plus another running into house...at least it looks that way. Fooled my 20-something neighbors who egged my house. They won't do that again. Now, their IQ's match their age, but this baby looks real. Plus the flashing red light makes it look likes it's recording. Runs on 2 AA batteries. Looks like a real day/night infrared camera. Kudos.

Reviews.Title: Dummy Security Camera Vs Real Cameras
Reviews.Author: Micael Vitt
Reviews.Content: They arrived on time in excellent condition. They were exactly what I expected from shopping and reading the reviews on Amazon. They were 2 teenagers terrorizing my neighborhood by lighting fires on people's fence's, trash and they lit the spoiler of my car in my driveway. They hit my neighbor on the corner 4 times. The arsonist were finally arrested. He installed 7 real cameras and a DVR for $1200.00 plus all the wiring. The detective in charge of the case said that fake cameras would work just as well. I purchased 1 DUMMY SECURITY CAMERA w/ Blinking Silver Light, 1 DUMMY DOME with a Red Blinking light (it comes with 2 security stickers) and a Solar 2 light LED Flood Adjustable Spot Light with a range of 30" and a BEWARE OF DOG SIGN. The fake cameras are identical to the real except for the inner mechanisms. They screw in and you can run electrical wiring from each DUMMY CAMERA into the house. Also, adjust your LED SPOT LIGHTS where you will think they are most effective. The Dome blinks RED and the DUMMY SECURITY CAMERA blinks silver. If you are up to no good, chances are is that you are scared of getting caught. They look real. I would just stay away from my house. I don't think they have the mind set to examine if they are real or not. They are blinking as if they are taking pictures and my LED SPOTS turn on. My price for all: $29.20 with free shipping. I am very happy and the quality of these DUMMYS are excellent. They look just like my neighbor's cameras and he spent $1200.00. If you examine the price difference, my choice is better than the real. I don't have to worry about real cameras failing and spending money to fix them. I can but 1 DUMMY for $7.24. It is a no brainer and endorsed by a head detective.

Reviews.Title: Pretty cool gadget!
Reviews.Author: m schmidt
Reviews.Content: We have had problems with the best of society wanting to turn our street into a lounge room. We put up this camera and it seems to have an effect! I even saw two lovely individuals hanging out on the other side of the camera's scope. So now we will add another to cover the "blind spot". We have installed a real surveillance system out of sight. At least if the fake cameras are knocked down, they only cost a little over ten bucks. We just put up the camera so I can't comment on the life of the batteries.

Reviews.Title: Realistic
Reviews.Author: GT
Reviews.Content: These Dummy Cameras look very realistic. When I installed them at the house and put the batteries in them, they look fantastic. You will not be disappointed with these. The bad guy has to think to himself when he sees this camera, "do I take the chance that it's not real"? I think the smart criminal would rather go to the next house that doesn't have a camera on it.

Reviews.Title: Total Junk
Reviews.Author: hellemar
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these. The cheap plastic connecting segment broke immediately on one, and the second unit stopped working within 30 days after I installed absolutely new batteries.

Reviews.Title: As advertised
Reviews.Author: ElephantManOfTX
Reviews.Content: These fake CCTV cameras are realistic looking and easily installed.  There are some limitations in the bracket design which prevents placing in some angles ... like with the bracket hanging down under an eave with the camera at the bottom.  Well worth the investment.  However, the decal enclosed is cheap looking and I just tossed them.  The red blinking light may be enough deterrent in itself.

Reviews.Title: Real cameras with the insides removed.
Reviews.Author: Visions Studio
Reviews.Content: Love them.  Everyone that sees them thinks they are real.  I didn't put batteries in them, don't think they are needed.  I believe a thief would look around to verify if cameras were present, don't need flashing lights to draw attention to them.  I bought a different sign for the side of the house, don't care for the decals that come with the "cameras".

Reviews.Title: Well worth it.
Reviews.Author: Barataria
Reviews.Content: Looks real and misc. theft at my store have decreased dramatically since this was installed.  It was a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Look just like the real thing at a great affordable price!
Reviews.Author: Kris
Reviews.Content: Have these above my garage and they look just like the real ones I also have mounted around the house.  Can't tell much of a difference!  Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: good Buy
Reviews.Author: Pete
Reviews.Content: Still running two years I change the batteries four times per year. Double A's. Red blinking light make it seem really real. just buy it.

Reviews.Title: Look terrific.
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: For the money it's great and if it makes one person stop and think before doing something they may regret, then it's more then paid for itself.

Reviews.Title: Lookis Authentic!
Reviews.Author: Scott LaBorde
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't be able to tell that it was not real, and I have a good understanding of electronic devices.  It will surely be a great deterrent.

Reviews.Title: Fools everyone
Reviews.Author: Mark F. Sebald
Reviews.Content: I've got 3 mounted on my house/garage.  EVERYONE thinks they're real.  Have had them for almost 6 months and so far.....have not had to change a battery.

Reviews.Title: Really nice
Reviews.Author: G. borges "Gilmar Borges"
Reviews.Content: I thought was just advertising, but the camera really looks like real camera, I suggest for your business or residence!!!

Reviews.Title: Thanks for a pleasant transaction!
Reviews.Author: Anastacia Bergeron
Reviews.Content: Thank you for a pleasant transaction! This dummy security light is just what we needed. Looks just like a real light, I had people asking me how much extra I pay with my security system for this feature..haha LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: Dummy security camera
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: It served our purpose very well untill we got our security program going.  No one knew they were dummy cameras.

Reviews.Title: For a dummie camera, it looks completely legit. Definitely an effective deterrent
Reviews.Author: Paul Jones
Reviews.Content: Considering purchasing another one.  Battery lasts for months, and seriously, this camera is very convincing. I did quite a bit of research before ordering this

Reviews.Title: Plastic screws.  Drains batteries within two weeks.
Reviews.Author: Just Me "Customer"
Reviews.Content: At a decent height it really does look like a real security camera  Which is why I gave it three stars.  The reason I deducted two is because the hardware they ship to hang it is garbage and even with fresh good energizers the batteries don't make it more than two weeks.I still use it.  I just quit putting batteries in it for the blinking effect.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: navtej gill
Reviews.Content: Looks exactly like a real one, I have. Now people are wary that property is protected strongly. Will recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: A little deterrent for a small price
Reviews.Author: D. Allin
Reviews.Content: After someone threw a rock through my window, and the police asked if I had security cameras, I wondered if I needed them.  After pricing a real security camera setup, and having seen typical security camera videos on the TV news, I questioned the cost-benefit ratio.  Even if the camera records someone, would the person be identifiable?  Probably not.  But these fake cameras might deter someone who isn't sure if they are real, and isn't sure they wouldn't be identified.  And for far less money.  These cameras look pretty fake close up, but mounted high up under the eaves of the house, especially at night, they appear quite real.  The little flashing red light adds to the impression.  I don't know how long the batteries will last, but mine have been working for three months and still going strong.  The swivel mount doesn't have much range, and reversing it to fit the way I needed was difficult, but not impossible.  Removing the cover to change the batteries is not all that easy, either, especially once the camera is mounted near the roof.  Still, for the price, it's a good way to make amateur criminals think twice before vandalizing or breaking in to your house.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Hazmatreview
Reviews.Content: This looks real except for the blinking light. It makes the camera way too obvious and unrealistic. I think cameras should be visible, but not obvious or calling attention to themselves. I have some real cameras also, and the infared lights do not flash and are not as glaring at night as this is. I just took the batteries back out have a fine looking security camera that looks real both night and day.

Reviews.Title: looks cool but...
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: The blinking red light is a dead giveaway that it's fake, turn it off it you buy this thing.  It's also made out of the cheapest plastic on the planet, the thing broke within 5 minutes of having it while I was attempting to rotate the camera base as it comes in a stupid position.It is really cheap, so I guess you get what you pay for here...

Reviews.Title: Will fool most people....Most.
Reviews.Author: TheRaceisLong
Reviews.Content: Let me get to the point: If you're looking for a cheap way to fool most people into thinking they are being watched, this product is excellent. As long as you are not extremely close to it, it's almost impossible to tell it's fake. So, here it is in summary:Pros:- Very affordable.-Adjustable tilt and angle.-Easy mounting.-Will fool most people, unless they have experience with cameras.Cons:-LED light is almost suspiciously bright (I've never seen a real camera that had such a "look at me!" bright light).-I mounted this outdoors, and have a feeling over time water will get into the housing, and cloud the lens. Will update if this happens, and what the battery life was like.I recommend this for very light security purposes. A fake camera will only help you so much.

Reviews.Title: mixed feelings, but overall glad I got it
Reviews.Author: Chilehead Photography "Captured Moments are t...
Reviews.Content: This item is pretty flimsy, so be careful with it.  Its also a clear fake when looking up close.  I was mounting this up high so it could not be inspected closely.  Despite this, I hope it will still serve as a deterrent, otherwise if the crook can tell its fake, it might embolden them to try harder.  If you are mounting this low enough where the potential thief can feel the cheap bracket and position screw, it will be a dead give away.  Make sure to mount it out of reach.

Reviews.Title: Very Realistic!
Reviews.Author: James Dalton Fenters
Reviews.Content: I ordered three of these cameras after I caught someone coming around my house when I was not at home. I have no longer had any trouble since I put these cameras up. They look very realistic and definitely do exactly what I wanted!

Reviews.Title: Fakes everyone out
Reviews.Author: 4runner
Reviews.Content: I've had 2 of these dummy cameras for about 3 years now.  I live in an area that gets hot summers and cold (below freezing) winters.  I have to say that even when the batteries die and the light stops working, it still creates curiosity and fear in strangers that I happen to talk to when they walk by or do work on my house.  Recently it faked out the mailman and he thought that we could see him coming because of the camera.  I have it mounted under the eve/gutter of my house next to the garage pointing down the driveway at the street.  It's helpful to have it mounted low enough that you can replace the batteries with just a small step ladder.  I moved in to the house in June and by October the LED was barely visible, so with warm weather the batteries only last for about 4 months.  In cold winter weather that is cut in half.  One note about the batteries and LED is that as the batteries die, the light gets dimmer and dimmer until it fades away completely.  I have been using brand new rayovac and duracell premium batteries and they both perform the exact same way.  This thing looks so realistic that I have had neighbors comment about who installed my security system.  I tucked the "wire" into a small hole in my eve and it looks like the wire goes into the eve and into my house from there.  Totally realistic camera.  Somewhat difficult to aim down really low if you mount it to a horizontal surface but if mounted to a vertical surface it can be aimed straight down if needed.  I was a bad teenager 25 years ago, and if I ever came across this thing at someones garage I wouldn't even think about going into that house or even the neighbors....you won't be sorry with this dummy camera.

Reviews.Title: Saved me some money!
Reviews.Author: Michael Hughes
Reviews.Content: I own an apartment complex, and finding discarded furniture behind the dumpster meant I had to call Waste Management and pay the fee to have them pick it up. Some were from tenants, and some were from people dumping that did not live there. I put this up, without the battery, on the side of the building (pretty high up) and pointed it at the dumpster area. I also installed a NO DUMPING sign, that had a picture of a security camera in the dumpster area. Its been close to a year and I have to say problem solved! Not one more item, where in the 6 months before it was probably one large item every other week.

Reviews.Title: These are awesome!
Reviews.Author: Dennis in Hawaii
Reviews.Content: Simply they look so real!  Mounts and adjusts easily.  Even comes with a dummy cable.  The included warning label looks real cheap, but suffices.

Reviews.Title: Love the red LED
Reviews.Author: Minh Pham
Reviews.Content: I mounted these outside my entrances and they look real, especially with the blinking LED. A set of batteries will last several months, so you don't have to climb up and replace the batteries very often. The plastic is rather flimsy, but what do you expect for this price; I think they are just disposables.

Reviews.Title: Looks pretty real
Reviews.Author: stephanie allen
Reviews.Content: This mounted really easily and looks pretty real. I put this fairly high on the house so from the ground it is very convincing especially with the blinking light. Up close and personal it looks pretty plastic and not as legit.

Reviews.Title: Looks good but didn't last
Reviews.Author: Robert Montanaro
Reviews.Content: Looks good, easy to install but the batteries didn't last very long, it's only a small LED but one set lasted a few days the other a couple of weeks. Much too frequent to make it viable to get the ladder out and change them that often

Reviews.Title: Looks Real!
Reviews.Author: ljt2520
Reviews.Content: These fake cameras look real. I snipped off the fake wire and did not load in batteries since I mounted these on trees and wanted them to look like realistic wireless cameras. Mount them high enough and you can't tell the difference. These are great!

Reviews.Title: So far they're buying it
Reviews.Author: C. Roth "Oma"
Reviews.Content: Well, at least we can say that so far since we have installed this along with a sign stating it is there... we have had no break ins.  We continue to hope that it "fools the fools" that are robbing our barns and stables...

Reviews.Title: Possibly saved my life, and helped catch 4 burglars
Reviews.Author: Jacob
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of those cameras, after I had my home burglarized by several crooks.  After doing so, I installed one of them above my garage.  The burglars actually DID come back and burglarize my home a second time, only 4 days later!  They must not have seen the camera at first, as they had robbed me in broad daylight and entered into my house.  They must have spotted it at some point however, as when the police arrived on scene one of the thieves was trying to knock the camera down with a stick!  Two of the criminals caught that day are now serving serious time, and the other two received probation for five years.  The only drawback to this camera is that it could not be used as conclusive evidence in the case, because there was no footage of the crime.  I can honestly say that this camera possibly saved my life, or someone else's.  These were hardened criminals, one of which appeared on Crimestoppers.  This is easily the best 10 dollar item I have ever spent.

Reviews.Title: Don't use battery's.
Reviews.Author: Randy
Reviews.Content: These look good but don't put battery's in them. The battery's power a small red LED in the camera front. Real camera's don't have a obvious LED showing in the front or any where else. Go look in a store using them and there are no LED'S. So if you have one showing the crooks will know its a fake.

Reviews.Title: Never received product
Reviews.Author: vector59
Reviews.Content: This company ships from China. My shipment never arrived. They promised to ship another one. Never got tracking information  Avoid this company like the plague!!! N

Reviews.Title: They fear the red light
Reviews.Author: davo73
Reviews.Content: I got one for a lake house I leave vacant for weeks at a time. I installied it in an area very visible from the road and a few weeks later my neighbor mentioned  to me while I was getting my mail that kids had been breaking into cars and trailered boats in the past but this year it has stopped he pointed at the camera and smiled. My good friend that installed a real camera system was over having a beer and mentioned how much better my cameras Infra red was than his!My handyman is the only person that knows its a fake and asked me where I got it from, he lives in a neighborhood that's pretty shady. I got one for him, he said that the undesirables don't walk past his house anymore and don't even park where they think the camera can see. Thieves aren't smart, they go for the easy score, that big flashing light is a universal sign that a live camera is recording and bad guys don't like to be recorded. I read a few reviews that said it doesn't look real because of that light, that's bull! Put it in a spot that people can see, make sure you change the battery every 6 months- that's what I have done just to be safe, and enjoy a cheap theft deterrent. I have had this this for a year now, and it has performed fine through rain, two blizzards, weeks of sub zero temps and close to 100 degree heat. Good product, buy an use with confidence, just don't tell anyone the secret.

Reviews.Title: Looks Real
Reviews.Author: J. Lantz
Reviews.Content: Entirely made of plastic but looks real.  For the price it is very nice.  I was able to open the enclosure and with slight modifications inset a "DropCam" into it.  I don't know how well it will hold up over time but it makes a low cost enclosure that looks real.  Dropcam only makes indoor units so this will be used in my attempt to make it an outdoor camera using this low cost item as an enclosure.  To make it work correctly I needed a 90 degree micro-USB cable but otherwise it looks great.  I didn't attempt to use the internal flashing LEDs nor would I if I had used it as a normal dummy cam.  It looks real enough without the issue of changing batteries.

Reviews.Title: Cheap insurance
Reviews.Author: R. Russell
Reviews.Content: Looks as real as they come. For the money how can you go wrong great addition to the real thing.

Reviews.Title: Great prouct!
Reviews.Author: Cheng Kun "kun"
Reviews.Content: It works great and keeps my house safe. I would like to recommend this great product to my friends. Ha.

Reviews.Title: Security camera
Reviews.Author: Willow
Reviews.Content: Purchased two dummy security cameras.  Installed easily. Wish I had installed these along with motion sensors years ago.  Looks just like the real thing.  My wife asked where the monitor was!  Next I will add four active cameras.  Thanks

Reviews.Title: Borderline looking fake and real.
Reviews.Author: Arbie Fuentez
Reviews.Content: For now it does its job in making a potential intruder think twice of breaking in until we can afford a real one.

Reviews.Title: good enough from a distance
Reviews.Author: rainmaker
Reviews.Content: I would not dare to put this one at the front door because if you look closely, you can tell it is a cheap camera made of plastic. From a distance, it looks genuine so I installed mine a few yards from the gates to my backyard. It has been over a month and the battery is still good. I recommend a real camera for the front door (if you are just bluffing anyway).

Reviews.Title: Not so effective at night
Reviews.Author: C. B. Gurney
Reviews.Content: This fake camera looks real and the blinking red light adds authenticity.  It should be noted, however, that most thieves strike at night.  This camera has no other light, so it can be missed in darkness.  It is useful to pair it with a motion detector light to make sure it gets noticed.  The bright yellow CCTV sticker that comes with the product is also a deterrent if displayed prominently.Mr Beams MB360 Wireless LED Spotlight with Motion Sensor and Photocell - Weatherproof - Battery Operated - 140 Lumens

Reviews.Title: Cheap an effective solution
Reviews.Author: varPrimeAddict
Reviews.Content: Had a lot of packages missing during Christmas. Installed it and it worked like a charm. I have an intrusion alarm system and this primarily to deter thieves from stealing my packages. Looks real with the wire sticking out and has a LED that I wouldn't turn on. No real cameras has a 24hr LED. Its a giveaway

Reviews.Title: works well
Reviews.Author: Viva
Reviews.Content: Everyone thinks these are real and even the local police told me that these would be somewhat of a deterrent for any thieves!  We have had several houses in our neighborhood with break ins and so I am able to have a little added comfort with these fake cameras.  I like the price until we can afford real ones.  They are a bit fragile though and I had to change the batteries after about 9 months.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: John mcclean
Reviews.Content: Look real hard to think that is fate just what I need has to get me another. And one for my daughter

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Leland Smith
Reviews.Content: The camera looks quite real with its flashing red light. It will repel most burglars from attempting to enter my home.

Reviews.Title: Great dummy camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: ALYSON  LIDDLE
Reviews.Content: This camera is really easy to fit, it looks the part, and it was very well priced, I will be buying another couple.

Reviews.Title: Dummy security camera
Reviews.Author: vetteguy53081
Reviews.Content: Looks authentic making it a great value. There are many choices and styles and this and feels real and has added Led light making a perpetrator think Twice

Reviews.Title: buen trato
Reviews.Author: Chato
Reviews.Content: they seem to do the job they are designed to do and friends think they are the real thing. i would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Looks REAL
Reviews.Author: Jorge Oblitas
Reviews.Content: The construction is very real, it has a cable and all the details to recreate a real Security camera (except the movement). The light is a great addition.

Reviews.Title: Well worth the price
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: So far the camera looks great and works great. Very easy to mount and very noticeable if you want it to be. Fantastic deal for the price I would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: Looks good and well made.
Reviews.Author: Daniel Coday
Reviews.Content: It looks like current camera systems.  BAtteries last a very long time.  From a distance, only experienced security personnel can tell the difference.

Reviews.Title: def worth the price!
Reviews.Author: A.M.
Reviews.Content: good camera for the price.  this is likely to fool anyone as long as it's not at eye level or within15 feet of reach.

Reviews.Title: easy to install
Reviews.Author: B.L.
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how much this could deter crime but it looks real from the ground.  I have installed where a person can't touch it without a ladder.  If someone was to touch it the fakeness would be realized easily.I didn't install the batteries as the red led flashing is a dead give away to a pro.  The IR cameras I have installed in the industry don't have flashing lights.

Reviews.Title: Looks pretty real
Reviews.Author: Patricia H. Stell "woodwoman"
Reviews.Content: Chose this dummy security gizmo over others because the write-up said it was the actual housing for a functioning security camera.  When I began my search, I also began noticing security cameras and this one does look real. Whether or not it works to discourage the petty pilferer who's been pestering me I'll never know: how do you prove a negative? Coupla hints: based on many of the comments left by other buyers, I did not put in a battery (they said the red light is a giveaway to thieves.) Also decided to spring for a sign/decal package, figuring if the camera is supposed to serve as a deterrent it would be a good idea to deter intruders from coming up on the porch or deck before they saw a camera. And, I bought and installed two cameras to (theoretically) cover both front and back of my home.

Reviews.Title: Very realistic looking
Reviews.Author: DocChuck
Reviews.Content: I have installed two of these on my property -- one covering the driveway and one in the back of the house covering the patio and the "walking trail" that comes very close to my house.  I have heard that some of the village residents "resent" being "spied upon", but OH WELL!!

Reviews.Title: Outdoor fake, dummy security camera.
Reviews.Author: Kenneth M. Moss
Reviews.Content: Got rid of the blinking red LED and replaced with a blue LED that doesn't blink. Very realistic looking. Very happy with this product.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera mounts with ease and the top slides on and off for one to put new batteries in. Love the blinking red light which is pretty bright at night and visible, which is good. We mounted ours up in the corner of an overhang by our front door and now have a pair of barn swallows nesting on the camera, so just be aware it can double for a bird nest or perch...but that's fine with us, cool to see the birds around. We mounted this camera initially b/c our jerk neighbor was kicking mulch in our front yard (townhome living...ugh) and also bought the Defender security 24/7 video camera sign which we put in the bed right where they were kicking the mulch. Of course our sign was also kicked and bent, so at times I wish this was a real security camera but after that initial pissiness from the neighbor seeing the sign, no problems since. Just can't wait to move....

Reviews.Title: works almost as good as the real thing
Reviews.Author: Ronald Creel
Reviews.Content: was having problems with the neighbors coming over and messing with my stuff,have not had that problem in 6 months; however I ran a orange phone line out of it to make it look wired in.

Reviews.Title: Could have fooled me
Reviews.Author: Mr Ranger
Reviews.Content: Absolutely looks real.  As long as you mount it out of reach, no one could tell otherwise.  A nice feature is that the fake wire can be routed out the back or down.  If you are installing on your house or garage, you would run the wire out the back mounting plate, as it would appear that power would be coming from inside through a hole drilled in the wall.  If you are mounting it on something like a telephone pole (as I did) you would route the wire through the hole that points down.  I ran a cable up the pole to the camera, burying the one end in the ground a few inches.  Unless someone climbed a ladder, they could never tell it is fake.If you are in a cold climate, make sure you use Lithium batteries.  Regular batteries will freeze and often-times break.  Lithium batteries will not freeze and thus will keep the red light blinking.  One reviewer said that "new" cameras don't have blinking lights and that the blinking light gives them away as fakes. I don't believe that most crooks know that.  Nor do I believe that even if they did no that, they would conclude there is no need to be concerned with your camera.  They may very well wonder if they are fakes, but will they bet their freedom on it?  I don't think so.  The blinking light draws attention to the camera.  And with fake cameras that is want you are trying to do.  You want every person who is scoping out your home to have his attention drawn to the camera, and that is what the red light does.

Reviews.Title: Looks very, very real!
Reviews.Author: thomasr1950
Reviews.Content: This is just what i needed. You can see the red light blinking at least a 100' away, even in daylight you can see the light blinking, it is brighter & more noticeable at night. My neighbors think it's real, i haven't told them any different. If someone looks up at the cameras they may think twice about doing anything stupid. It comes with a wire coming out of the bottom rear. I removed the wire & added my own to make it look even more real. I have the wire coming down to the ground to assist in looking realistic. I bought 3 & installed them all high enough off the ground so they can't be messes with without a ladder or chair. If you are like me & want something inexpensive to help deter mischiveous people get these cameras. Not sure about the battery life but that's not a big deal as the red light blinks.

Reviews.Title: Camera broke.
Reviews.Author: Kar
Reviews.Content: The camera looks realistic. However, it broke when I tried to adjust it. Do not recommend this to other consumers.

Reviews.Title: BROKE-try another brand that can be returned if defective
Reviews.Author: Karan L. Paulson "Perfectionist"
Reviews.Content: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS CAMERA!!!!!!!!!!  Find another BRAND which is more sturdy.ALSO, THE TIME FRAME TO RETURN IT IS "UNUSUALLY" SHORT SO NOW I AM STUCK WITH A "DEFECTIVE PRODUCT"I knew it was a not too sturdy plastic camera and was being very careful with it.Well I carefully turned it on the mounting and the plastic mounting bracket just snapped off.  The plastic mounting bracket may have been defective or just plain not sturdy enough.Now there is no way to mount it.  I tried duct tape with no luck.

Reviews.Title: LOVE, LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Mary Warren
Reviews.Content: I feel safe with just the presence of the camera even though it doesn't really do anything.  The blinking light and the camera look very realistic.  I wish it had an on/off switch so that I could turn it off during the day to extend the battery life.

Reviews.Title: Good quality
Reviews.Author: Bean Bean
Reviews.Content: Great, inexpensive way to give the appearance of surveillance. Easy to install - just insert batteries and screw it in, and the red light starts blinking. I'm sure if you get super close, you can tell it's fake, but a quick glance (which most people will do) won't give anything away.Make sure you put it in a place where it looks like there could be power so you can keep up the appearance that it's a real, working camera.Our batteries lasted approximately three months before they needed replacement. We've had this product installed for three months and it's still working fine.

Reviews.Title: Realistic look
Reviews.Author: SumTingRight
Reviews.Content: Came ontime and as advertised. Does it job and looks real. My friends think I'm locked down tighter than a military base and don't even know they're fake.

Reviews.Title: Looks like the real thing.
Reviews.Author: yblirt
Reviews.Content: Have some actually cameras, but they have a blind spot here and there so just put one of these where it will be noticed.  Also have a sign showing we use video cameras, so everyone are warned in front.

Reviews.Title: Looks so real
Reviews.Author: Lane Jacobs
Reviews.Content: These cheap little plastic camaras are awesome and look real. After hearing about thuggy dudes knocking on doors then 1. either breaking in when no one answers or 2. Barging into the house when someone answers, I decided to put one of these up high in my front porch. We live in an affluent area and this camara looks like all my neighbors' real camaras. I installed one at my front door and one in my garage above the door that goes into the house.

Reviews.Title: No flashing light
Reviews.Author: wendy
Reviews.Content: Received camera fast but Flashing light never worked we changed batteries and bought new ones and never worked.. Very diss appointed

Reviews.Title: exactly what it looks like
Reviews.Author: GuppyKat
Reviews.Content: it looks like an oversized all-plastic camera, and it is.  I don't suppose any would-be burglars are going to be inspecting it by hand in full daylight, though, so that may not matter.  I bought this upon suggestion of the responding police officer after my garage was broken into for the second time, it will serve as my blatant visual deterrent (with no batteries, have you ever seen a real surveillance camera with a blinking red light? its not a handheld family movie recorder, people) and the real cameras are set up elsewhere.I feel that the batteries would serve a better purpose if they dimly lit the circle of "LED bulbs" in order to give off the ever-so-faint red light that my real cameras do, rather than the silly bright blinking one that my real cameras do NOT have.The "authentic" cable referred to in the product description is a flimsy piece of plastic tubing (think drinking straw with the diameter of a phone charging cord), but again, this probably won't be inspected up close.  it is of sufficient length to accommodate any positioning of the camera and still appear to be wired into the mounting surface through the bracket.  I appreciate the attention to detail with this feature, as i didn't even think about it, and was pleasantly surprised that it was included, as were the necessary mounting screws (including drywall mounting pieces), and a (folded) CCTV security system sticker.  absolutely zero literature included in the package, but since its not a real camera, its not needed.  you basically just figure out where you want it, and put it there.  pretty simple, really.TL:DR fully plastic, LARGE camera, unnecessary red light (save yourself the heartache of batteries) meant to just serve as a deterrent.  You get what you pay for. Would still recommend.HANDLE CAREFULLY, it *is* plastic, after all.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Tim Compton
Reviews.Content: this is a very good looking fake. It will save me from shooting idiots that might prowl around my house at night

Reviews.Title: battery is very easy to run out
Reviews.Author: leo
Reviews.Content: the thing is ok but you always find that the LED goes off because it uses up the battery very fast....

Reviews.Title: Clearly plastic
Reviews.Author: Desiree C
Reviews.Content: We ended up returning this item because the plastic dummy security camera did not look genuine. It was flimsy and did not look like it would hold up in the elements.

Reviews.Title: Fooled me
Reviews.Author: jrentrop
Reviews.Content: Looks so real it is fooling everyone who sees it..but shhhh..don't tell anyone that it is fake. Light weight and easy to install.

Reviews.Title: Outdoor Fake Security Camera
Reviews.Author: robert d dingeman
Reviews.Content: Fake cameras work perfectly. At the height now installed, they are as realistic as expected. Thus, corrected to perfect star review.

Reviews.Title: Great realistic camera's
Reviews.Author: Joe Stapleton "Joe Stapleton"
Reviews.Content: I really like these fake security camera's as they really do look real.The blinking Red light gets your attention.They also furnish a yellow sticker to warn of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Simply the best
Reviews.Author: Joshua
Reviews.Content: It can't get any better than this.for $10 you get every thief to think 3 times before making off.I also added some postings available here on Amazon to have the complete package.Really really good.

Reviews.Title: Looks like a real Camera
Reviews.Author: Claudio A. Dos Fo
Reviews.Content: Looks like a real Camera. It doesn't tell where to put the batteries though. You have to slide the cover and will find the battery holder under it.

Reviews.Title: :) It fooled me.
Reviews.Author: Nicco
Reviews.Content: When I got this in the mail it was easy to install. The same day my brother help me installed it because I was to lazy to go back and forth up and down the ladder. We installed the 1st 2 and I went back to get the ladder and the drill to install the other one and in the back yard to my surprise I scared my self for a minute. I look up and I saw the camera there and I had to reprogram my mind and say" Hello...you in your own backyard and your not a thief or are you doing anything wrong." I just had to laugh to myself and finish the job. My tip is to get rechargeable batteries so you won't have to spend to replace them all the time. Try not to put it in a place to high where you can't reach to replace the batteries and don't let anyone see you replacing them.Pros: It looks real and seem that electricity is working through it.It can move in many angles.It's very affordable and durableCons: It is very light and fragile so if you plan to be rough with it for install you better have glue on hand.

Reviews.Title: Perception is everything!
Reviews.Author: Gabrial Groves
Reviews.Content: Have a large home with a small lawn where dogs would deposit their used food.  We don't have dogs and could never catch the culprits in the act.  Also had some kids loiter behind the house on occasion doing what kids do.  Installed two of these cameras - one at the entry and one on garage and have not had any problems since!!!  They look so real and the flashing red sensor sells it.  Theres also a small black fake wire that makes the unit look hardwired!!!  The visual is so convincing that we gave one to a loved one.  Best security you can get for so little - highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: I do love it!
Reviews.Author: Bonnie Price
Reviews.Content: The camera looks  so real and  is so easy to install! The battery's aren't that hard to install either! Great!

Reviews.Title: well made and fooled 2 pro security installers
Reviews.Author: P. Triana "Pete"
Reviews.Content: here is a trick, real cameras dont blink so i prefer not palcing the batteries in, but it is more than passable and well made, even my ADT installer was like "when did you get that one"

Reviews.Title: awesome!
Reviews.Author: Yang LIU
Reviews.Content: looks real! and easy to install. i like it. and ordered a second one. best you can get. strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Looks So real
Reviews.Author: Abigail Warner
Reviews.Content: After viewing tons of these dummy cams, I finally settled on this one for the appearance and price. So happy I did. These cameras look real, the blinking light is great. They arrived quickly. Can't beat the price!

Reviews.Title: Yes!
Reviews.Author: Marcell McDonald
Reviews.Content: After viewing tons of these dummy cams, I finally settled on this one for the appearance and price.  So happy I did.  These cameras look real, the blinking light is great.  They arrived quickly.  Can't beat the price!

Reviews.Title: Fake CCTV Cameras
Reviews.Author: J. Ledford
Reviews.Content: I must say, for the price, these are not a bad deal. If you look REALLY close you can tell they are fake...but seeing as 99% of people are going to put these above eye level, no one will know the difference. Very convincing...also, the CCTV sticker that was added in is a nice touch!

Reviews.Title: Intimidation at a low price!  They look like the real deal
Reviews.Author: C. Rilling "Dave K in TPA"
Reviews.Content: I mounted these on a house I am renovating and they look very realistic and probably quite scary to anyone thinking of breaking in.  The blinking red light makes you (reflexively) think twice when you find yourself walking out the door and see this dummy camera looking back at you.  Lots of fear factor for a very low price!

Reviews.Title: Perfect and great price.
Reviews.Author: Ct. Yankee "Mac"
Reviews.Content: Does what it's supposed to do - looks authentic!  That's all you need.  Even the neighbors think it's real and asked me where I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Great fake camera.
Reviews.Author: Teddy Burl Wilson Jr.
Reviews.Content: This fake camera looks as real as the real ones and no one that has seen it can tell that it is a fake one.  Yes I would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Look just like my real ones!
Reviews.Author: goelvis
Reviews.Content: Bought these specifically because they look just like my real cameras, I just wanted some more out back.These also come with a "CCTV" sticker for putting on your windows. Great little "cameras"

Reviews.Title: looks like the real thing
Reviews.Author: A.G
Reviews.Content: use it for the business as a deterrence against crimes and thankfully, crime has gone down. looks like the real deal.

Reviews.Title: Nice Product
Reviews.Author: William Archie
Reviews.Content: looks real. Easy to install. Customers like the product. works well together with real cameras- it distracts the thieves, cause they think that those are real and they dont pay attention to the real (hidden) cameras.

Reviews.Title: Looks Real
Reviews.Author: Ryangene
Reviews.Content: I am just rating this 5 stars and I've written a review 5 times now for this but amazon isn't taking my submissions so just writing something simple this time.  Battery life works good

Reviews.Title: Cheap, reliable, long lasting battery life and REALISTIC
Reviews.Author: Ryan Barbour
Reviews.Content: you wont believe how many friends of mine thought they were real.  i installed them almost 10 months ago and the flashing red light is still working on the same batteries.  froma  distance they are very convincing

Reviews.Title: Yep, you get about $9 worth of product....
Reviews.Author: metzmatt "metzmatt"
Reviews.Content: This product is pretty much what it claims to be: a cheap fake security camera.I paid about $9 for each one, and I got pretty much the cheap stuff I expected.It might look good enough to ward off amateur burglars, which is what I was looking for. But here is a list of the things I DON'T like about the product:> The camera does NOT come off the pivot mount, which can make it very difficult to access the screws to mount the flat plate to the wall or other surface.> You should plan on throwing away the screws provided. They are made of VERY soft metal, and the philips slots will strip out very quickly if you get just a bit off of straight in. Unfortunately, because of the PRIOR bullet, it's nearly impossible to drive the screws in straight because the camera doesn't come off the mount.> The flat plate that mounts to the wall is thin and cheap - if you over-tighten the screws even just a little bit you will crack the plate.> The whole thing is very cheap plastic. I doubt that these will last more than one or two seasons of heat (I live in the Phoenix metro area). I imagine the same problem might occur with very cold winters such as in the midwest. You could argue that for $9 it's OK to replace them every year or so; I would counter that although the expense is low, these are generally mounted very high and are not easy to access for removal, replacement or servicing.> The rubber tube which is the faux "wiring" for the faux camera looks good, but again, I doubt that it will stand up to more a one or two years of extreme heat or cold.BTW, based on reviews that suggested the batteries last only a few months, and my lack of desire to climb a high ladder every other month to change batteries, I did NOT install batteries, so mine don't have the blinking red light. Some other reviewers have suggested that REAL security cameras don't have blinking lights, so they may be right that having the light blink simply advertises the fact that these are not real. I just don't know.Summary: They appear to meet the bill in the short term, but I doubt that they will last.Here's what I'll likely do when these fail: I'll find some unrepairable REAL cameras and install them. Because they're real, they will LOOK real and be more durable, and because they're unrepairable they should be cheap.

Reviews.Title: Make it less fake
Reviews.Author: Stuart Sweetow "sweetow"
Reviews.Content: When mounting this camera, the top hood (with the silly lettering "CCD Camera") came off. Yay! That makes it look more real. I didn't put in any batteries, because real cameras don't have flashing red lights.The knob on the bottom lets you aim the camera where you want it. It looks real to me. So far no robbers have entered the property where my "real" camera is on the job.

Reviews.Title: Keeps the kids from skate boarding on our picinic tables.
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann Rhing
Reviews.Content: This product is simple to use - Just put it up in the area that you want to protect - I recommend some "video alert" signs too. It has been highly effective for us at our small private school.

Reviews.Title: fake
Reviews.Author: Mark Weiss
Reviews.Content: I like the idea of this fake camera although I am not sure if it would make my home "seem" like it has something worth stealing by having it attached to my house.
